title: 1  Introduction to JavaScript
text:
1.1 Settings
Before getting started, let’s set the development enviroment. There are many ways to develope and excute JavaScript, for this tutorial, I am using VScode. VScode has great integrations with JavaScript, HTML, and CSS, and seamless integration with Docker. In addition, it has great integration of Quarto, which used to create this document. If you want to follow the same settings, check the instractions below.

1.1.1 VScode Settings for JavaScripts
If you don’t have VScode install, you can download and install it directly from VScode website. I also using Live Server extention, which enables you to launch a local development server with live reload feature for static & dynamic pages.


1.1.2 Docker
TODO Setting docker with VScode

title: 1  Introduction to JavaScript
text:
1.2 Getting started with JavaScript
JavaScript (also known as JS), is one of the most popular programming lannguage for web development. It typically used to create web pages applications, mobile apps, games, and great data visualizations tools. You can run JavaScript on your web-browser (e.g., Chrome, Safari, Firefox, etc.):
Screen record here*
While you can use your web-browser as consul for ad-hoc code test, the development of JS applications done inside a script using code editor such VScode, notepade, etc. It is common to have JS code embaded inside HTML script (or calling JS script from HTML script). Here is a basic example:
.
├── index.html
├── index.js
└── style.ccs
